posts.author: SolidusMath
posts.content:
Okay, one more. I have found my building skills to be severly lacking so maybe I can tell you guys what I desire and see if you can lead me to it. Thanks so much in advance.

I want to play a stealthy warrior with some tricks up his sleeve. My thought was either FTR/ROG/WM (as per an erlier reuest completly fufilled by Empyre65) I have thus found that for my play style, wants from a character, and leveling speed that the requirments of WM are too stiff for me. So after much going on allow me to tell you what I want and see if there is hope for a horrid builder.

Skills
-Rog skills including MS/HS, Tumble, UMD, and if possible The three trapskills. Bluff would be nice for disguise but seems a pipe dream at this point.
-Other than that DIsclipine and Heal (as heal seems needed tell me if I am wrong)

Feats
-TWF/ITWF with Katana (as these weapons are considered small on my PW) This means I will have to be STR based but it is possible to have 16 or 17 STR/18 DEX at first level with gifts +2STR/+2DEX (with +2 elc). I would put all 7 ability points into STR so if it started at 17 I would end at 24 by LVL 30 and 18 DEX my whole career using either studded leather or a chain shirt and with tumble and towershield when needed maybe his AC will suffice?
-KD/IKD for the sneak attack damage I hope to have.
-Improved Crit Katana
-WF/WS Katana and EWF/EWS as it seems too big a boon to damage to leave out
-To fit in Blind fight and toughness by looking at other builds it seems the only way.

Abilitys
STR17 (with +2 gift)
DEX18 (with +2 gift)
CON12
INT14
WIS10
CHR8

My spread thoughts were RAN 9/ROG 11/ FTR 10 but this would mean higher WIS unless I waste the potential for spells, I don't know? W
Would It be better to do straight FTR/ROG/ASS? If so bluff would be perhaps more important than Trap skills? and would my BAB be too low to hit anything?
Also am I being hard headed in the use of katana and TWF? AS they can not be finessed am I cutting my own throat with a ROG by not going DEX and ED? It seems waiting his whole career and building only DEX to be a stiff penalty also.

Any questions you guys have I would be happy to answer. And please don't hold back and tell me my mistakes in thought or if what I desire is too much (out of a build)or too little (power wise as PvP is not some thing that happens often but it does happen)
Thanks again.

EDIT* (these)(are)(my)(other)(weakness)

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
If the katana is not finessable, then your character would need to be STR-based, but that would hurt your stealth. Splitting your attention between STR and DEX would meant that neither one would be very good. If you ever want a STR-based dual-wielder, on Arelith, it looks like katanas are the way to go, but if you want a stealthy character, then you need to be DEX-based, so you must use a finessable weapon.

EDIT: Sorry, I GTG. I'll build something for you late tonight. I'll try to squeeze in Exotic Weapons Proficiency, so you can use kukris instead of only shortswords.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
IMO it is possible to have a strength based stealth character. You plan on going dex 18 and str 24. That gives a +4 dex bonus and a +7 str bonus. The difference is only +3. You can get that from skill focus feats in hide and move silently. If you take the feat Stealthy, you will get +2 to both hide and m.s. from a single feat.
You will not get it for free, it will cost you a feat or three, but it is possible.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hey, Empyre.

I'm looking at your build Rogue Monk Fighter and I see a way of doing it better:

Go Rogue 16 Monk 6 Fighter 8. That way you'll get Improved Knockdown FOR FREE, more Monk Speed bonus at the cost of 2d6 Sneak Attack. Here is what you have to do:

Drop Epic Prowess on lvl 27 and Take Epic Dodge as a general feat instead of the Rogue Bonus feat (which you will need to drop. Then with that last Rogue Feat you keep Crippling Strike. with the Fighter 8 Bonus Feat you can re-take Epic Prowess and lose nothing except the 2d6 Sneak Attack damage. However, with IKD, you now have one more way to generate sneaks, so you will do more average damage per round even though you lost 2d6 of sneak attack. Plus, having KD on a 10 APR build is always nice

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Mick, why don't you drop 3 Fighter levels for Barbarian levels? You can drop Stealthy and have Barbarian Rage to raise your Strength once a day. Or, you can drop Improved Evasion and drop 3 Rogue and 1 Fighter, maintaining the same number of feats, but gaining another use per day of the Rage. I don't have time to look heavily into the build, but this is what I thought of improving. That could open space for some DEX gear, and hence a lighter set of armor, which would reduce the Hide and MS penalties.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Maximillian Kane wrote:Mick, why don't you drop 3 Fighter levels for Barbarian levels? You can drop Stealthy and have Barbarian Rage to raise your Strength once a day. Or, you can drop Improved Evasion and drop 3 Rogue and 1 Fighter, maintaining the same number of feats, but gaining another use per day of the Rage. I don't have time to look heavily into the build, but this is what I thought of improving. That could open space for some DEX gear, and hence a lighter set of armor, which would reduce the Hide and MS penalties.

Take it EZ!
This is not your average strength build. In this case strength and stealth is a "Must Have". The armor penalty of Chainshirt is only -2, something this character can live with. If there is dex gear/cat's grace available you can aim for dex 22 and downgrade your armor to leather with no armor penalty.

What really needs improving in this kind of build is the abysmal will save. UMD helps get gear with save boosts/immunities and mind protection spells.

You address the fact that the character will benefit from both dex and str buffs. And the number of item slots is limited. Barbarian is not a bad idea as a means to improve strength. It's a pity the rage only lasts for a couple of rounds. Barbarian will also improve speed. But plucking away the stealth feats is a no-no, unless there is nobody out there with high spot and listen skills. I would also keep Improved Evasion as this is a strength build and the reflex save is only medium high.
Take it easy
